action.action-desc: Mr. Cotton (for himself and Mr. Gowdy) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend section 2423 of title 18, United States Code, to eliminate a defense, to a criminal prosecution under that section, based on the state of mind of the defendant as to the age of the minor engaging in, or intended to engage in, a commercial sex act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protect Children from Sex Tourism Act of 2013 .

section.header: Elimination of defense based on the defendantâ€™s state of mind as to the age of the minor engaging in, or intended to engage in, a commercial sexual act
section.text: Subsection (g) of section 2423 of title 18, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

subsection.text: In a prosecution under this section based on illicit sexual conduct, as defined in subsection (f)(2), the Government need not prove that the defendant knew the minor engaging in, or intended to engage in, a commercial sex act had not attained the age of 18 years.
